quotes.quote: We have too many high sounding words, and too few actions that correspond with them.
quotes.author: Abigail Adams

quotes.quote: He can compress the most words into the smallest ideas of any man I ever met.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: Words calculated to catch everyone may catch no one.
quotes.author: Adlai E. Stevenson Jr.

quotes.quote: Words are the physicians of the mind diseased.
quotes.author: Aeschylus

quotes.quote: Language is the source of misunderstandings.
quotes.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quotes.quote: Let thy speech be short, comprehending much in a few words.
quotes.author: Aprocrypha

quotes.quote: High thoughts must have high language.
quotes.author: Aristophanes

quotes.quote: Grasp the subject, the words will follow.
quotes.author: Cato the Elder

quotes.quote: Use soft words and hard arguments.
quotes.author: English Proverb

quotes.quote: The great enemy of clear language is insincerity. When there is a gap between one's real and one's declared aims, one turns as it were instinctively to long words and exhausted idioms, like a cuttlefish spurting out ink.
quotes.author: George Orwell

quotes.quote: A man thinks that by mouthing hard words he understands hard things.
quotes.author: Herman Melville

quotes.quote: For me, words are a form of action, capable of influencing change.
quotes.author: Ingrid Bengis

quotes.quote: When ideas fail, words come in very handy.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.quote: Deeds, not words shall speak me.
quotes.author: John Fletcher

quotes.quote: Words ought to be a little wild for they are the assaults of thought on the unthinking.
quotes.author: John Maynard Keynes

quotes.quote: The great thing about human language is that it prevents us from sticking to the matter at hand.
quotes.author: Lewis Thomas

quotes.quote: Man invented language to satisfy his deep need to complain.
quotes.author: Lily Tomlin

quotes.quote: We have really everything in common with America nowadays except, of course, language.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: Words have a longer life than deeds.
quotes.author: Pindar

quotes.quote: Language exerts hidden power, like a moon on the tides.
quotes.author: Rita Mae Brown

quotes.quote: Drawing on my fine command of the English language, I said nothing.
quotes.author: Robert Benchley

quotes.quote: No one has a finer command of language than the person who keeps his mouth shut.
quotes.author: Sam Rayburn

quotes.quote: Do not accustom yourself to use big words for little matters.
quotes.author: Samuel Johnson

quotes.quote: Works of imagination should be written in very plain language; the more purely imaginative they are the more necessary it is to be plain.
quotes.author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quotes.quote: Broadly speaking, the short words are the best, and the old words best of all.
quotes.author: Sir Winston Churchill

quotes.quote: Think like a wise man but communicate in the language of the people.
quotes.author: William Butler Yeats

quotes.quote: Speak properly, and in as few words as you can, but always plainly; for the end of speech is not ostentation, but to be understood.
quotes.author: William Penn

quotes.quote:
I understand a fury in your words,
But not the words.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote:
My words fly up, my thoughts remain below:
Words without thoughts never to heaven go.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: They have been at a great feast of languages, and stolen the scraps.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare
